ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.2_0: At one time Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had shared the robe-cloth for a monk to use it without first being relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.3_0: He told the monks, who said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.4_0: “Venerable Upananada is using a robe that he has transferred to me, even though I haven’t relinquished it.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.5_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.6_0: “How can Venerable Upananda use a robe that he has transferred to a monk, when that monk hasn’t relinquished it?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.7_0: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.10_0: “... Foolish man, how can you use a robe that you have transferred to a monk, when he hasn’t relinquished it?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.11_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
